required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enthesitis Assessment Before and After Anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor Treatment in Spondyloarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Ultrasonographic Enthesitis Assessment Before and After Anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor Treatment in Patients With Spondyloarthritis
clinical_study.source: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

brief_summary.textblock: Biological therapies should be considered in patients with high disease activity despite nonsteroid antiinflammatory drug treatment. The first option among biological therapies is anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor (anti-TNF) drugs. In recent years, anti-TNF treatments have shown that clinical and ultrasonographic enthesitis may improve as well as disease activity, quality of life and acute phase reactants. In this prospective study, we aimed to evaluate the clinical and ultrasonographic evaluation of enthesitis and to determine its response to anti-TNF treatment in patients with SpA.In this prospective study, we aimed to evaluate the clinical and ultrasonographic evaluation of enthesitis and to determine its response to anti-TNF treatment in patients with SpA.

study_design_info.masking_description: All patients were evaluated by the researcher who had a 10-year experience of musculoskeletal ultrasonography and is blind to clinical evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: change from ultrasonographic entesitis score at 3 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 months after anti-TNF treatment
primary_outcome.description: Madrid Sonographic Enthesitis Index was used to screen etheseal sites

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 months after anti-TNF treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index was used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 months after anti-TNF treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score was used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 months after anti-TNF treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Ankylosing Spondylitis Quality of Life was used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 months after anti-TNF treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Functionality Index was used

arm_group.description: Spondyloarthritis patients who was initiated TNF alfa blocker

intervention.description: TNF inhibitors are widely used in patients with spondyloarthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Spondyloarthritis patients were diagnosed according to 2009 Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe cardiovascular and respiratory diseases,
- Severe liver and kidney failure,
- Pregnancy and lactation,
- Active infection,
- Malignancy,
- Demyelinating diseases,
- Systemic lupus erythematosus,
- History of knee, elbow, foot and ankle surgery,
- Fluoroquinolone, retinoid and fluoride use,
- Local corticosteroid injection at the examination sites within the six weeks before evaluation
- Peripheral neuropathy

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization
